title: Money Talks; The new logic of trade
text:
We hear from Ngozi Okonjo-Iweala, director-general of the World Trade Organisation, about the WTO's complicated history and contested future. US Trade Representative Katherine Tai explains where she thinks the current rules-based system falls short, particularly when it comes to China. And Pamela Coke-Hamilton, head of the International Trade Centre, identifies the winners and losers of this new era. Runtime: 35 min
